author: Special Correspondent
text:
A Delhi court on Monday stayed an order for the forfeiture of a surety of Rs. 4 lakh furnished by TERI executive vice-chairman R.K. Pachauri.

Mr. Pachauri is facing prosecution on charge of sexually harassing a woman researcher at TERI.

A Metropolitan Magistrate on February 19 forfeited his surety, observing that he had deliberately violated travel conditions imposed on him by overstaying in Sharjah by one day, where he had gone to receive a lifetime achievement award.

The stay order came on a revision petition filed by counsel for Mr. Pachauri denying that his client had deliberately violated the conditions. “The order dated February 19 passed by the Metropolitan Magistrate shall remain stayed till the next date of hearing,’’ Additional Sessions Judge said.
title: Delhi court stays forfeiture of Pachauri’s surety
